This is version 2 of the file.

Purpose

Table class for the OFTL Lua interface.

Daniel “q66” Kolesa quak.nosp@m.er66@gmai.nosp@m.l.com

License

lua

namespace lua

Table_Iterator_Base

template<typename T> struct Table_Iterator_Base

A forward iterator for Table.  Inherits into non-paired version Table_Iterator and paired version Table_Pair_Iterator.

Note that Lua table iterators are not full forward iterators, they’re missing some features (post-increment, -> operator and true iterator comparisons).

Summary
Functions
Table_Iterator_BaseConstructs an empty iterator.
Table_Iterator_BaseConstructs an iterator from another iterator.
Table_Iterator_BaseConstructs an iterator from a Table.
Table_Iterator_BaseTakes care of proper stack handling when all iterators to the current table disappear.
++Moves on to the next item, prefix version.
++Moves on to the next item, postfix version, same effect as the prefix version.
==Note that this compares just the iterator status, not the iterator, so it’s useful just for checking if the iterator is valid or invalid (against iterator returned by Table.end or Table.pend).
!=Note that this compares just the iterator status, not the iterator, so it’s useful just for checking if the iterator is valid or invalid (against iterator returned by Table.end or Table.pend).

Constructs an empty iterator.

   const Table_Iterator_Base &it
): p_table(it.p_table), p_status(it.p_status), p_refs(it.p_refs)

Constructs an iterator from another iterator.

Table_Iterator_Base

Table_Iterator_Base(const T *t): p_table(t), p_status(0), p_refs(new int(1))

Constructs an iterator from a Table.

Table_Iterator_Base

~Table_Iterator_Base()

Takes care of proper stack handling when all iterators to the current table disappear.

++

Table_Iterator_Base& operator++()

Moves on to the next item, prefix version.

++

Table_Iterator_Base& operator++(int)

Moves on to the next item, postfix version, same effect as the prefix version.

==

friend bool operator==(const Table_Iterator_Base &a,
const Table_Iterator_Base &b)

Note that this compares just the iterator status, not the iterator, so it’s useful just for checking if the iterator is valid or invalid (against iterator returned by Table.end or Table.pend).

!=

friend bool operator!=(const Table_Iterator_Base &a,
const Table_Iterator_Base &b)

Note that this compares just the iterator status, not the iterator, so it’s useful just for checking if the iterator is valid or invalid (against iterator returned by Table.end or Table.pend).

Table_Iterator

template<typename T> struct Table_Iterator: Table_Iterator_Base<T>

A forward iterator for Table.  See Table_Iterator_Base.  This one works with values only, no keys.

Table_Pair_Iterator

template<typename T> struct Table_Pair_Iterator: Table_Iterator_Base<T>

A forward iterator for Table.  See Table_Iterator_Base.  This one works with pairs of keys-values (see Pair).

Summary

Dereferencing Table iterator returns a Pair of Object instances corresponding to the current table key-value pair.

Table

struct Table: Object

This structure represents the Lua table.  You can get its elements of various types, set them or manipulate metatables.  See also Table_Item.

Summary
Types
itAn iterator typedef for standard table iterator (loop by values).
pitAn iterator typedef for paired table iterator (key-value pairs).
Functions
Table
TableConstructs the table object from any object that has an “object” method.
TableConstructs this instance from the raw lua state pointer and the index of the value on the stack.
beginReturns an iterator (it) to the first element of the table.
endReturns an iterator (it) to invalid element of the table (so you can end the iteration).
pbeginReturns a paired iterator (pit) to the first element of the table.
pendReturns an iterator (pit) to invalid element of the table (so you can end the iteration).
getGets an element of this table or of a contained table, depending on the amount of arguments.
[]Gets a Table_Item with a name given by the index.
setSets the table element.
set_metatableSets a metatable for this table.
get_metatableGets this table’s metatable.
lengthReturns the length of the held value.

Types

it

An iterator typedef for standard table iterator (loop by values).  Useful mostly for arrays.  For others (and even for arrays) you’ll want to use pit.

pit

An iterator typedef for paired table iterator (key-value pairs).  Key-value iterators work also for arrays, keys are numerical and represent the current index.

Functions

Table

Table(): Object()

Table

template<typename T> Table(const T &o): Object(o)

Constructs the table object from any object that has an “object” method.

Table

Table(lua_State *L,
int idx): Object(L, idx)

Constructs this instance from the raw lua state pointer and the index of the value on the stack.

begin

Table_Iterator<Table> begin() const

Returns an iterator (it) to the first element of the table.  Useful for arrays.  For others, you’ll want pbegin (and even for arrays).

end

Table_Iterator<Table> end() const

Returns an iterator (it) to invalid element of the table (so you can end the iteration).  See begin.

pbegin

Table_Pair_Iterator<Table> pbegin() const

Returns a paired iterator (pit) to the first element of the table.  For arrays, you’ll sometimes want to use begin.  If you need explicit references to array indexes though, this will come into use for arrays as well.

pend

Table_Pair_Iterator<Table> pend() const

Returns an iterator (pit) to invalid element of the table (so you can end the iteration).  See pbegin.

get

template<typename T = Object, typename... U> T get(const U&... args) const

Gets an element of this table or of a contained table, depending on the amount of arguments.  The gotten type defaults to Object.  Example:

lua::Table tbl = lua.get<lua::Table>("tbl");
// tbl.foo.bar.baz
lua::Object baz = tbl.get<lua::Object>("foo", "bar", "baz");
// tbl.bah
int bah = tbl.get<int>("bah");

[]

template<typename T> Table_Item<T> operator[](const T &key) const

Gets a Table_Item with a name given by the index.

set

template<typename T, typename U> void set(const T &key,
const U &value) const

Sets the table element.  You can also use [], which calls this indirectly via Table_Item.

set_metatable

void set_metatable(const Table &metatable) const

Sets a metatable for this table.

get_metatable

Table get_metatable() const

Gets this table’s metatable.

length

size_t length() const

Returns the length of the held value.

Table_Item

template<typename T> struct Table_Item

Represents a table element.  It does not contain any data itself, just a reference to the table it belongs to and the element name (aka table key).  You can set the element through it or get its value as any supported type.

Summary
Functions
Table_ItemInitializes the table item from a key and a Table.
Table_ItemInitializes the table item from another one.
setSets the element value in Lua.
=See set.
=Explicit version for Table_Items.
toReturns the data belonging to the element as any supported type.
pushPushes the value on the stack.
is_nilReturns true if the object is nil, false otherwise.
objectReturns the underlying Object as const ref.

Initializes the table item from another one.
